website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Seeker is gaining ground as a go-to shoe for those who want to have lightweight and comfortable performance on the roads. It’s designed for neutral runners who want to have a great shoe for their athletic activities, but it’s also efficient when it comes to casual purposes.
pros: The lightweight mesh material used in the upper of the Saucony Seeker is breathable and comfortable to the skin
The overlay system has been hot-melted onto the upper, turning it into a single unit that’s free from unnecessary layers, excess stitching and added weight
Cushioning for the dimensions of the foot is given by the padded tongue and collar
Runners welcomed the inclusion of a comfortable sock liner, which offers contoured support for the individual wearing the shoe
Shock attenuation and responsible underfoot cushioning are given by the high-quality mid-sole foam units
The XT-600 rubber is appreciated by many because it provided long lasting protection against wear and tear, as well as traction over the asphalt
cons: There were complaints that the Saucony Seeker looks somewhat bulky, which went in contrast to its lightweight nature

customer_reviews.title: Grata price but run a bit on the tight side.
customer_reviews.text: I have have 5 other pairs of Saucony sneakers and these fit the tightest of all of them. I bought t them for the gym and treadmill use but after my 1st day not my favorite shoe the kinvara are superior but also $$$. Price was great And styling is nice. Will update fit later one again. I wear and 10 in all others and I could have used a 10.5.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lajavrac

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit small / Darker than picture
customer_reviews.text: These Saucony running shoes are very comfortable although a bit smaller than expected. (I could probably go up 1/2 a size.) they're also very dark. In the picture, they look light grey and dark grey. IRL they look dark grey and black. I'm keeping them because they're so cushy and because they're pretty dang sharp -- although not quite what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes they are comfortable and seem to be good quality. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable! Would've given more stars but inside of heal ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Would've given more stars but inside of heal fell apart shortly after wearing and rubbed the back of my heal raw. I even put duck tape over it because I liked them so much, but it didnt hold up
customer_reviews.author: zenswrd

customer_reviews.title: Good sole
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. Don't run anymore. Good shoe for walking around. Doid arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Daemon Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly, I have a bunion on the joint ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly, I have a bunion on the joint below my right big toe and Saucony shoes are the only shoes that fit without rubbing against it.
customer_reviews.author: Jubalcain

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Saucony chaged for the worst
customer_reviews.text: Saucony use to be all of wear. Now for the past few years they just keep getting cheaper and cheaperly made out of nothing worth giving away
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: They seem well made and are very light and comfortable shoe. Excellent shoe especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: They fit right to size. They seem well made and are very light and comfortable shoe. Excellent shoe especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: super comfortable, would have liked them to have been darker black. Otherwise I love them
customer_reviews.author: Ralph A Currie

customer_reviews.title: so I've only worn them once but so far they were great. After my 3 mile run
customer_reviews.text: I'm only using them as running shoes for now, so I've only worn them once but so far they were great. After my 3 mile run, my feet felt great, and they fit nice. There's lot of nice cushion in the shoes, so as of now I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Eddins

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair, the first pair lasted a year. I wear them everyday for work, where I am on my feet all day. The hold up well and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DragonLily

product_meta.title: Saucony mens GRID SEEKER-M Grid Seeker
product_meta.description: If only your car was this good on the road. Designed with contemporary features for comfort, durability and protection from the elements, the Seeker gives you a great ride on any road.
feature_bullets: Lightweight running shoe featuring knit-mesh upper with plush tongue and collar
Flex grooves in the outsole create a more flexible ride
Heel Grid System and IMEVA midsole provide a cushioned underfoot ride
